intro: Cloezia artensis, commonly known as the Artensian cloezia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Due to habitat loss, Cloezia artensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
